channel.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post
channel.description: The Washington Post Sports section provides sports news, video, scores, analysis and updates about high school, college, and pro sports teams, including the Capitals, Nationals, Redskins, United and Wizards. Post Sports also offers blogs and discussions about the latest sports news.

image.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post

item.title: DC Sports Bog: John Wall, John Carlson and Newt Gingrich among the notables in Washington 2024 Olympic video
item.description:
In its push to become the U.S. Olympic Committee’s choice as its 2024 Summer Games candidate city over contenders Boston, Los Angeles and San Francisco, the D.C. 2024 bid movement released a video Tuesday touting the unity “in this town.”

Read full article >>
item.dc:creator: Scott Allen
item.ExtractedText: By Scott Allen December 10 at 11:32 AM Follow @ScottSAllen (Via YouTube) In its push to become the U.S. Olympic Committee’s choice as its 2024 Summer Games candidate city over contenders Boston, Los Angeles and San Francisco, the D.C. 2024 bid movement released a video Tuesday touting the unity “in this town.” “In this town, we have learned that no one of us is as good as we are together,” the video begins. The video features politicians from D.C., Maryland and Virginia, including U.S. Del. Eleanor Holmes Norton (D-D.C.), former House speaker Newt Gingrich, U.S. Rep. Elijah Cummings (D-Md.) and U.S. Sens. Mark Warner and Tim Kaine (both Virginia Democrats). It also features local residents doing the unity hand symbol ( more or less correctly ), Capitals defenseman John Carlson and Wizards players John Wall, Otto Porter and Bradley Beal. Capitals and Wizards owner Ted Leonsis is vice chairman of the D.C. bid. The USOC board will meet on Dec. 16 to decide whether to bid on the 2024 Games after listening to presentations from all four cities. The AP reports that the USOC could announce its candidate city immediately following those presentations or wait until 2015. (Via YouTube) (Thanks to For the Win for sharing.) Scott Allen writes about all things D.C. sports. Follow him on Twitter @ScottSAllen or e-mail him if you’ve got a tip to share.
